001import javax.swing.JComponent;
002
003import java.awt.Graphics;
004import java.awt.Graphics2D;
005import java.awt.Color;
006import java.awt.Font;
007/** GameOverMessage.java - A class to display game over message at end of game
008* @author Daniel Andrews
009* @version Final Project
010*/
011public class GameOverMessage extends JComponent {
012        private double x, // x and y coordinates to display message
013                                   y;
014        private int score; // Final score is displayed in message
015        
016        /** Constructor sets coordinates and final score
017        * @param x x coordinate to display message
018        * @param y y coordinate to display message
019        * @param score Final score to display in message
020        */
021        public GameOverMessage(double x, double y, int score) {
022                this.x = x; // Set coordinates and final score
023                this.y = y;
024                this.score = score;
025
026                setForeground(Color.WHITE); // Set color and font of text
027                setFont(new Font("Courier", Font.PLAIN, 14));
028
029        }
030
031        /** Paints component on graphics canvas
032        * @param g Graphics canvas to paint on
033        */
034        @Override
035        public void paintComponent(Graphics g) {
036                super.paintComponent(g);
037                Graphics2D g2 = (Graphics2D) g; // Cast to 2d graphics canvas
038
039                // Draw message in center of screen
040                g2.drawString("Game Over", (int) x - 50, (int) y - 50);
041                g2.drawString("Final Score: " + score, (int) x - 70, (int) y - 35);
042        }
043}
